meanings.definition: A miscalculation or error that has an unexpected negative effect.
meanings.sent1: The plan to skip breakfast turned into a backfires when I felt dizzy before lunch.
meanings.sent2: The team's decision to change the lineup backfires and they lost the game.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leaky faucet backfires when he accidentally breaks the pipe.
meanings.sent4: The shortcut through the park backfires as they encounter a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The decision to invest all his savings in one stock backfires when the company goes bankrupt.

meanings.definition: A loud noise caused by the premature ignition of fuel in the engine of a motor vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic knew the engine was in trouble when he heard a loud backfires.
meanings.sent2: The old car often backfires when starting up in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The backfires from the motorcycle startled the nearby birds.
meanings.sent4: The sudden backfires from the truck made the pedestrians jump in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The backfires from the vintage car echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect of what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His attempt to impress her with a joke backfires and she ends up laughing at him.
meanings.sent2: The prank backfires when his friends turn the tables and scare him instead.
meanings.sent3: Trying to surprise her with a gift backfires as she had already bought the same thing.
meanings.sent4: The plan to stay up late backfires when he falls asleep during the movie.
meanings.sent5: The attempt to speed up the process backfires and causes more delays.
